title: A mutually exclusive answer
description: Follow this pattern when users may need to select either none or all available options.

frontMatter.title: A mutually exclusive answer
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern when users may need to select either none or all available options.
frontMatter.intro: In some questions, either none of the options or all of them may apply to the user. This pattern addresses how to handle these situations.

when_to_use.value: **All or none scenarios.** When users may need to select either none or all available options in response to a question.

design_principles.value: **Checkboxes: Include 'select all that apply'.** Add instructional text when using checkboxes.
**Avoid dedicated all/none checkboxes.** Users can already select multiple or zero checkbox options.
**Radio buttons: Include all/none options last.** When genuinely mutually exclusive, add 'all of these' or 'none of these' after other options.
**Consider alternatives.** Reframe the question, break into separate questions with conditional logic, or explicitly state that selection is optional.

examples.title: Checkboxes with select all that apply
examples.description: Checkbox group with instructional text allowing multiple or no selections.

examples.title: Radio buttons with none option
examples.description: Radio button list including a "None of these" option at the end.

how_to_build.intro: Choose the appropriate form control based on the selection requirements.

steps.value: For checkboxes, include 'select all that apply' instructional text.
Don't create dedicated 'all of these' checkboxes—users can already select all.
Don't create dedicated 'none of these' checkboxes—users can already select none.
For radio buttons, include 'all of these' or 'none of these' as the last options.
For select boxes, follow radio button rules for all/none options.

accessibility.value: Ensure instructional text like 'select all that apply' is associated with the fieldset.
Screen readers should announce the selection instructions.
All options must be keyboard accessible.
